text: Dark black with thin head. Kinda like a black ipa. Thin body. Some chocolate.
Tap at apex in Portland. Black with small white head. Roasted malt nose. Taste is very roasty, light chocolate. Medium body. Rich roasted malt . Good classic stout.

Bottle. BBE date Aug 2012; Drank Oct 2011 - Opaque Black in colour. Heavily sedimented. Very Malty; roasty malts, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, nuts; oats. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins. Hoppy; balancing resinous hop bitterness. Good sweet/bitter balance. Slightly salty; hints of soy sauce. Bitter sweet roasty malty throughout. Lovely Stout! (2011-10-29)
Pour is dark brown with a medium tan head. Notes of toasted malt, nuts, molasses, dark chocolate, and licorice. Finish is sweet, dry, and smooth.
Kawa, czekolada, nuty leśne. Dość męczące w smaku, ciężko wypić całe. On tap Tap House.

Świetny FES, wyraźna kawa, czekolada i praliny, uzupełniona leśnymi, chmielowymi akcentami. Ładna piana, kremowa tekstura i wyraźna, acz nie męcząca kawa powodują, że to piwo bardzo dobrze się pije. Nisko wysycone, dobra rzecz.

Black with off white head - Some roasted malt in the aroma - Malt body with chocolate flavours and some bitterness from roasted malt and hops - The roasted malt and chocolate flavours goes into the finish - This was good

Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel and light hoppy. Black colour with tan head, mostly diminishing. Taste is light+ sweet and moderate malt bitter. Medium+ body, oily feel and light malt bitter finish.
Solid, classic stout. Roasted barley, chocolate, good amounts of hoppyness to boot.

Black hue under a thin light beige head that gives off a roasty and chocolaty aroma, with a mild earthy sweetness. Smooth and slightly sweet and earthy smokiness, bittersweet dark cocoa, and stoutly flavors meld in a nice harmony that although tasty, colors inside the classical lines a bit much. A touch of American bitterness.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a glass. Black with small beige head. Aroma is nice dark malt, medium body, lower carbonation, and pretty good small-bubble lacing. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, dark malt, some ash, and some herbal slightly bitter hops.

Bottle:
Nearly black with a light tan head.
Chocolate, chocolate powder aroma.
Melted chocolate, roasty chocolate malt, oat flavour.
Soft and comfortable...
Nice....as solid as they come.
Tap. Pours black with beige lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt and dark dried fruits. The taste is the same but includes some coffee and some chocolate but not so much dried dark fruits.

bottle @ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Rich aroma of malt and chocolate. Nearly opaque black color, brown head that slowly drops to a full cover, lots of lace streamers. Taste is rich creamy roasted malt that adds medium fizz on a swallow that also introduces dark chocolate and black coffee. The coffee becomes an effective bittering agent. So much flavor, but so smooth and easy to quaff. A solid stout.

Medium dark roasted and toasty malty, rich with notes of chocolate, caramel, light coffee, a nice sweetness coming into balance with the bitterness of the hoppy backing in support, smooth and creamy on the palate, a lovely stout.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained, light beige head, with slight lacing, over a clear black brown (SRM 35) body.....nose is roasted malts with cocoa, chocolate notes, dried fruit including plum, raisin, balance to the malts......taste is lightly sweet with dried fruit notes, hints of toffee/caramel, roasted malts with chocolate, light coffee, finishing with a moderate hop bitterness, balance to the malts......mouth feel, medium body, light alcohol, moderate carbonation making a creamy mouthful. This is lovely, rich, but gentle Stout. The malts are dominant, but hops too are present, making for a nicely balanced beer, which approaches the Baltic Porter, Imperial Stout styles. BJCP 9/3/15/4/7

Black as the deepest dungeon with a fine beige top. Solid lacing down the glass. Almost one curtain all the way. Looks solid. A bit mild aroma at first. Served a bit cold. Fine intensity after a while. Cramy lovely texture. Full body and a soft carbonation. Lovely balance between sweetness and bitterness. Nice balanced flavor with chocolate, coffee, toffee and some roast.[On tap at Crowbar in Oslo, Norway]

Dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark chocolate, & some coffee; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, dark, chocolate, coffee, and some hops; Nicely balanced; Very solid stout.

From tap @ Carlsens. Pours pitch black with an off white head. Aroma of heavy roasted malts, coffee, hints of licorice, very light soy. Taste is heavy roasted malts, light body, dry finish, light soy, coffee, caramel, light ashy.
Tap c4. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roast, coffee, malty, light hops, dark choco, caramel. Taste is very roasted smooth choko, toffe notes, cofee notes. Very smooth and slick. Very good

Aroma has roasted malt, caramel, cocoa and vanilla. Taste is malty with quite long bitter aftertaste. Flavors of roasted malt, vanilla, cocoa and some herbs. Nice straightforward and tasty stout.
Tap @ Doge Helsinki. Pitch black with light brown head. Smooth and typical stout with notes of coffee and and chocolate.

fra fad
duft: røget malte chokolade kaffe lidt tobak. 
smag: maltet lidt kaffe. ristet eftersmag mørk bitter malt chokolade ok bid fra humlen.

(Tap at Fairbar)
Black body with a beige head.
Malty roasted aroma and flavour with liquorice notes. Sweet and bitter taste, with spicy notes.
Full body with soft carbonation.
Bottle shared by Tmoney99 (thanks) at Cincinnati RateBeer tasting on September 26, 2015. Very dark brown hue, very good roasted malt aroma, sweet syrupy flavor. Not my favorite stout but not bad.

Bottle from Kwicker Liquor via Moose and enjoyed in the Hilton Bonnet Creek suite living room after a long day of Mickey's Christmas Party. Dark brown pour with a nice tan head that lasts and thick lacing. Aroma: menthol, tart fruit, dark fruit and chocolate. Flavor: dark, dusty, baking cocoa with some tartness and lingering bitterness with a hint of booze; does this also have a hint of salt? Busy but good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a murky brown color with a smaller sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have chocolate, caramel, nutty character, light roast, some bitterness that lasts through the finish, a nice compliment to Hr. Frederiksen. Pretty straight forward roasty, stout that is easy to drink.

500 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99 - thanks again, Tom! Pours a brown color with amber highlights and edges and a small beige head that laces the glass and settles into a ring and bit of film. Notes of oasted malts, chocolate, black olive, fudge, earth, and caramel. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a sweet, toasty mouthfeel. Not terribly complex or memorable, but just a solid, well-made stout.
Bottle. Chocolate, roasted barley malt, and dry grass aroma. Chestnut brown with moderate head. Sweet smooth chocolate malt and moderately bitter herbal hay flavor. Nice body.

Bottle. Poured black color with an average brown frothy head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate toasted chocolate malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark chocloate sweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration.

Bottle shared at Cincinnati tasting pour cloudy dark brown with moderate tan head. Nose nice roast, milk chocolate, coffee. Taste sweeter malt up front, then milk chocolate, mocha, and light roast. Easy drinking and smooth.

@ phaleslus cinci tasting. 500ml bottle, thanks to tmoney99. Nice heavier roast malt, bit of dark chocolate, some coffee. Hazy dark brown color. Ring of off-white/grey head, some bits of lace. Medium body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Dry finish. Very mild bit of chewiness, but some. Nice long roasty stout aftertaste, with a bit of dark fruit. Moderate bitter taste, very light sweet. More dry. Touch of smoke. Solid, tasty stout, very flavorful for the ABV, nice long aftertaste on this.

Bottle. Pitch black, creamy, beige head. Aroma of chocolatr, coffee, fruits, mollases. In taste semi sweet with lots of dark chocolate and coffee. Medium bodied, medium bitterness. Oily texture. Very nice.

7/03/2015: Amager Fru Frederiksen... Very much like Amager Hr. Frederiksen with bitter dark chocolate, hints of black plum, mineral-like molasses, roasted malt, undertones of coffee, nutty, but a bit less intense and definitely less alcoholic. I think this one has more of the mineral characteristic coming through. Good, not great. Seems highly over-rated? 500 mL bottle from Party Source.
Dark oil black pour. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is coffee, chocolate heavy. A bit creamy and thinner. Overall very good stout.

Black pour off white almost beige head .... Aroma is of oats, dark malts, chocolate, roasted malts and light coffee ..... Taste is of dark roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, earthy and some sweet silky chocolate .... Has a light bitter hop bite ..... Has a bitter bite on the back end and into the finish which is roasted and has lingering coffee flavor .... A worthy woman for hr.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head with slight visible sediment. Body is full and carbonation low. Aroma is quite coffee driven with some brown sugar. Vanilla and chocolate also is evident. Dark fruits also appear particularly raisins and plums. Taste is much like aroma. Coffee dominates with some citrus undertones. Chocolate and dark fruits are also evident. Taste ends slightly burnt and smoky. Had this back to back with hr. frederiksen. This was much more relaxed and balanced. Great beer!
50cl bottle thanks to Papsoe. Lovely dark color with thin to medium beige head. Interesting dryness. Medium bitterness. Aroma is super roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, light fruit.

Wonderful aromas of chocolate malt and light coffee. Think its quite right with coffee and chocolate flavor. Light fruity and bitter too. Quite so heavy bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. Really good beer but maybe a little too bitter for my taste. Otherwise, it is excellent. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Big crispy malts.. wheat... grassy citric hops...
bitter and sweet
very good

Pours an average frothy light brown head that mostly dominishes. Body is black, sparkles are visible.
Aroma contains moderate malts (light bread, roasted and toasted malts, nuts, molasses, dark chocolate, coffee), moderate hops (perfume, pine, citrus fruits), light yeasts (leather, mold) and grape, raisin, apple, pear, cherry, vanilla, licorice and cola.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet, followed by sweet, sweet and light bitter and finishing in bitter, like espresso.
Body is medium to full with creamy texture and soft carbonation. 
Mmmmm! Full of flavors and aromas, subtle yet strong. Very good.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep darkest brown with ruby highlights in the tulip glass. Lots of mocha and vanilla in the aroma, along with milk chocolate and treacle. Taste is strong yet gentle. Dark chocolate, milk chocolate, coffee, molasses, some soy and a light hop bitterness in the finish. A little metallic in the aftertaste. Medium bodied and very smooth. Not boozy at all. Very good but let down slightly by the metallic aftertaste.

500 ml bottle purchased at Julios Liquors. Nice appearance with some mild retention. Aroma is a hearty roasted grain, old coffee grounds, a different fruit note (not dark fruit) and a vanilla hint. Pretty interesting. 
Flavor is pretty much a carbon copy of what is going on in the aroma. Fuller body with velvet texture over the taste buds. The nicest aspect of this is the lingering deep roast with a mild licorice hint.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours Brown with white head. Taste is roasted malts slight watery finish.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark brown with a slight tan head. Aroma of near burnt dark malt with a hint of chocolate. Med body, maybe better. Flavor is slightly "sour" dark burnt malt with some dark chocolate and probably a ggod dose of bitter hop. With time it develops a touch smoke. Nice stuff.

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl West. Pours near black with a transient tan head and a rich chocolate and treacle aroma. There is a full-bodied smoky dark molasses flavor with a hint of coffee and a dry finish.

Drinks bigger than its 7% though it shows no heat. Similar to hr frederiksen (seems to be a house yeast as well as similar hops and malt) just less. Maybe even a unique water source as it lets you know right away it's an Amager beer.

Bottle@ølhus stockholm. Black, off-white head. Soft roasty, dried figsy fruityness, pencil oaks. Quite light easy body. Soft roasty, nice flavoured. Some oaky tarryness. Real nice. Has a good deal of abv, but drinks light. Flavourful, good.-- bb

A főzet kitöltve sötétbarna, leginkább fekete, kávészínű és ahhoz hasonló sűrűségű ital képét mutatja, melyre egy puha, vastag habfedél telepszik hosszú-hosszú percekre. A habkorona süllyedésével csipkés krémréteg fodrozza a tejszínes, cappuccinós, rumos-kekszes, kakaós illatfolyamot, melyet a maláta és az élesztő telt karaktere mélyít. Ez a teltség az egyes kortyok során is megmutatkozik, apró szemű szénsavbuborékokkal sűrűn teletűzdelt, bársonyos teste olajosan csúszik, útja mentén hamu, pörkölt kávé karcos sziluettje tűnik fel, amit süteménytésztás zamatok, vanília, keksz és rengeteg maláta gömbölyded ízjegyei kerekítenek le és töltenek meg tartalommal. Kiváló stout.

Bottle. Pours Black with a dense, long lasting, light Brown head. Aroma has lots of oatmeal, licorice, chocolate and burned- and caramel malts. Taste has leather, oatmeal, a bit of smoke, chocolate, licorice, hoppy fruits, bitter roast. Mild, yet full body. Very smooth. Medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark black pour with a quick dissipating java head. Nose is roasted malt, chocolate , coffee with some bitterness. Taste is rich malt, with deep chocolate and coffee notes and some nice sweetness. Finishes on the same tasting notes, with a moderately long sweet tasty finish. Quaff Score 8 / 10

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head and aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is of dark malt, chocolate, smoke, and bittering coffee and hop notes while sweet with a burnt, roasty finish. Delicious stout

Bottle at home (Batch nr 521). Pours black with almost no head. Sweet aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, hops. Taste is hops, chocolate. roasted malts. Bitter hoppy aftertaste with roasted/burned malts. Very nice, but maybe bit too hoppy bitter.
500 ml. bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, vanilla, and a hint of smoke. Tasty.
Bottle at home. Pours black, dry roast, light chocolate, bitter, coffee, creamy.

500 ml bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a thick black with a khaki colored head of foam that fizzles out pretty quickly. The atom a has roast, anise, ash, and a bit of licorice. The taste is a dry sweetness with a bit of roasty character. Some leather comes out. Thicker body and mouthfeel. Despite the fizzy head, the carbonation seems to be more on the low end.

Bottled. Black Beer, creamy tan head. Roasted grainy, licoricy notes, a touch of caramelly biscuit aroma. Fruity fermentation aromas. Sturdy, almost creamy maltiness, ripe fruitiness, sweetly herbal hops, dry and resiny bitter finish with coffee and dark chocolate. Velvety, very soft texture, good carbonation. Very good stout.

Botella de 50 cl en el lúpulo en septiembre de 2013. Lote 521 hasta 11-2015. bastante buena stout con sabores y aromas maltosos tostados con toques rústicos de cebadas nórdicas. Cuerpo medio con 7 vol y un regusto final ligeramente amargo. Bastante buena y para repetir.
Dark black colour, beige head. Roasted aroma with notes of coffee and dark chocolate, also a sour touch. Not very well balanced. Maybe this bottle was over the top.
Bottle from Voldby. Dark brown/black pours with a tan head. Dark roasted malts, chocolate malts, hops, coffee, hint of licorice. Roasted light bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Bottle from Ölhus Stockholm, Helsinki. Pours black with a head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma of roasty maltiness, coffee, dark chocolate and some licorice; quite rich. Taste is dryish, medium to heavy roasty and also has some balancing bitterness in the finish. The robust malt character makes the taste varied. It is complemented by some hoppy notes. The palate is medium to heavy bodied, sticky. Nice rich stout where malts dominate and hops add depth.

Bottle at Ølhus Stockholm. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with coffee, chocolate, nuts, roasted malts, dark fruits and hops. Bitter finish with coffee, hops, nuts and roasted malts. Magnificent stout.

batch #521, schenkt als cola maar oogt als zwart éénmaal in het glas met een volle maar dunne kaki kraag.
aroma van chocolade, zoetig, gebrande en geroosterde mouten, maar erg goed !
smaken zijn matig zoet, redelijk bittertje, sterke smaken, redelijk moutig, koffie, donkere chocoalde en iets laurier. geroosterde mouten.
medium body, glad en iets dun van textuur, lage co2, afdronk is zoetig. 
het aroma is over het algemeen beter dan de smaak !
Duft av kaffe, lakris, sjokolade og vanilje. Lite skum, litt langs kant. Dyp mørk sort farge. Smak av kaffe, lakris, sjokolade, vanilje og frukter.
Svært farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av malt, sjokolade og kaffe. Smak av malt, sjokolade lakris og kaffe. Fruktig. Melkebaren.

Bottle, shared with Parksy and Grippitis. Very dark brown, mahogany highlights, lively brown head. Aroma is of rich roast, chocolate, and lots of fruity hops with a hint of plastic. Creamy body, rich roast and dark chocolate with surprising lightly spicy nuances, generously hopped with a bitter finish. Fantastic.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 750 mml Bottle tasted at home. Dark colour with small head. Heavy coffee presence on the taste and roasted malts. The finish is bitter and there are a lot of sediments. Perhaps too much carbonation for a stout. Next one please.

Bottle 50cl from Henrik thanks. A dark beer with medium creamy off white head. Nose is on dark chocolate, dark coffee and light metallic touch. Aroma is roasted medium creamy, lot of dark coffee, chocolate, licorice, light peated touch. Finish is bitter slightly acrid.

Bottle offered by a good friend. Color: dark black beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: rye malty nose with some wheat presence. Coffee. Taste: coffee taste good equilibrium, really drinkable with a medium creamy sensation. Aftertaste: coffee expression and malt.
From a bottle shared in Park City UT. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of dark cherries. Flavors of dark fruits with a hint of licorice. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Roasted finish.

black pour with small brownish head. aroma is coffee malts bit of chocolate.
taste is coffee chocolate and some wood?
body is too thin

Shared 50 cl bottle. Pours black with a small light brown head, liquid is a bit see through when held up at a light. Lots of soysauce, caramel and burnt malts in the nose. Taste is dominated by coffee but I also get toffee and chocolate notes. Quite pleasant!

DWF; Pours black with a fading bobble off-white head. Aroma and taste is roasted malty, dark chocolate and expresso. Medium to full bodied, thin to oily texture. Finish is lasting chocolate bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a brown black with a large tight soapy tan mocha colored head that settles to a thin soapy film. Aroma has good bitterness of hops and chocolate roasted malt and some faint marsh mellow/vanilla. Taste has more bitter hops with pine/spruce and milk chocolate some yeast and good roasted malt and sugars. Palate is medium somewhat coating and dry. Really tasty!

Bottle, courtesy of northropfrye. Dark brown pour, huge beige head. Aromas of chocolate and lactose. Flavours of chocolate and cherries, fairly sweet with light dark chocolate bitterness. Smooth but thin texture.
Loads of foamy head kind of crazy. Aroma od cocoa dark chocolate lactose sweet fruit. Taste is roasted malts cocoa chic covered cherries. Nice beer.
Pours black with crazy tan head. Nice aromas of chocolate, vanilla, lactose and some jammy sour fruit notes. Tastes are smoky with dark chocolate roasted malts and sour fruit at the end. Thin palate.

bottle 50 cl. Batch #521
Appearance"Allmost black,very dark redish brown with a dense creamy tanned head.
Nose: Roasted aroma with a little bit of smoke, caramel and chocolate malts
Taste: good coffe taste, with in the background some caramel sweetness just to round it off and make it more drinkable, however this not a sweet beer.
Dry finish, long lasting bitter aftertaste with sime hops and a bit of chocolate.
Medium body, medium carbonation. Creamy texture.
dark, coffee-like appearance with one inch brownish head; aroma of coffee, roasted malt and fruitness;taste is the same; not too complex, but ok stout

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, licorice, citrus, bread, biscuit and ash. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of chocolate, ash, licorice and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Bit thin.

Schwarz, hellbeiger schaum, aroma nach geröstetem malz, kaffe u schokolade, antrunk malzig süsslich, abgang herb (aber nicht extrem intensiv), feine rezenz

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: coffee, mocha, chocolate.
TASTE: coffee, anise, chocolate, malts.

A red brown drak beer, with a good light brown firm head. In the nose there is soft warm coffee smell, and a touch of smokiness. It is a medium to light bodied beer, with a decent carbonation. In the taste there is a hard and strong dominant coffee taste. There is also a little sweetness what makes the beer soft and round, but it is at an distance. In the aftertaste there is strong coffee and hops. A decent stout, but a bit monotone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50 cl. bottle, batch # 521, poured in to a snifter. Black with a reddish tint, dense, creamy tanned head. Roasted aroma with smoke, caramel and chocolate malts, mild coffee and licorice. A hint of nuts. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture. Finishes dry and long lasting bitter. An excellent stout.

Pours a rich burnt umber color with a finger of khaki foam. Lots of earthy roast and bakers chocolate on the nose... the palate follows with some nice dark dried fruit, more chocolate and a heavy roast that leans towards the burnt spectrum. Nice bit of bitterness creeps in with the long roasted finish.
Bottle. Pours near black with an espresso head. Aroma is coffee, char, roast and some berry. Taste is sweet with smoke, roast and bitterness. Medium bodied and slick. Pretty good.
Dark with white head. Mild vegemite smell (extract). Taste is savoury roast. One dimensional. Nice finish of bitterness. Overall, not a mind blowing stout but obviously crafted with love.

Fast schwarzes Stout mit feiner, bräunlicher Crema, allerdings auch vielen unappetitlichen Schwebeteilchen. Typisches Stout Aroma mit Röstmalz und Kaffeenoten. Außergewöhnlich gut gelungen ist der schöne, bittere Nachzieher des Hopfens, mit 60 IBU auch ordentlich bemessen. Nettes dänisches Stout!
Pours dark brown with two fingers of tan head with a little lacing. Smells of mellow malts. Tastes of bitter and malts with a hint of hops. A little watery on the palate with a nice long bitter.

Bottle. Pours black with a small but dense beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, some light fruits and lots of hops. It has a roasty aftertaste which is bother bitter and very dry. Not bad, but I prefer Hr. Frederiksen.

9/VI/13 - 50cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ my parents place - BB: VIII/2012 - batch: 192 (2013-548)
Clear dark brown beer, irregular beige small head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: vanilla, caramel, mocha, floral notes, sweet and a little spicy. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of mocha, pretty sweet, caramel, bit of vanilla, sourish touch, bitter hops. Aftertaste: mocha and coffee, caramel, bit sweet, bitter hops, bit floral, dark chocolate.

Nice complex aroma of hops and medium dark chocolate. The taste also contains chocolate and hops but also a little burnt coffee. I would recommend to drink this one fresh so you dont loose the hops character.
Pours dark brown, almost black with light beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Flavour of roasted malt, burnt sugar, hoppy bitterness and coffee. This is why basics matter.
Det här var en ytterst angenäm upplevelse, med mycket rostade toner och en balans som gjorde mig uppspelt. Därefter avslutade den med en finfin efterbeska. Slutsats: jo, man tackar!

(bottle) pours black in colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of herbal hops, strawberries, mango, tobacco, brown sugar, alcohol and blackberries. flavour is brown sugar, dark chocolate and heavy chocolate icing, with notes of herbal hops and espresso, slightly sweet, with a light roasted-bitter finish. medium to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.
Ecco cosa succede quando un imperial stout incontra una double ipa...birra luppolotostata
Gedronken @Qdt,  met dutchdrebus, joes en benzai, zwart van kleur en geen schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt naar koffie, chocola,

Bottle shared with the Oirschot crew @ QDT 13. Opaque pitch black color, small to medium sized beige head. Aroma of malts, dark chocolate and lightly roasty. Taste malts, light to moderately roasty, medium bitter, lightly chocolate. Medium body, a bit dry texture, low to medium carbonation.

Bottle @ #Bexit tasting thx to benzai. Pitch black colour with a small light brown head. Smells coffee, roasty, dark chocolate. Tastes coffee, roasty, dark chocolate. Amazing taste. Medium to full body, soft carbo, lasting taste.

Medium statured light brown head with good retention and a nicely coating lace. Black, opaque appearance. Nose is dry, vinous with notes of black berries.Body is med/full, low carbonation, lil chewy and grainy. Dry, roasty malt flavors with notes of coffee and berries, a lil black patent, bittersweet chocolate and burnt caramel.Dry, roasty finish. BIG Stout. Bottle from statelineliquors.

Bottle from Market of Choice, Eugene. Pours very dark. Aroma is sweet and boozy, lots of roastiness, chocolate. Mouthfeel is surprisingly lively, finish is slightly grassy, Centennial hops are saying hello. Very, very nice overall. Like a IPA had a baby with a barrel-aged stout. Yum!

A black beer with a dense, beige and big head. Aroma is strongly roasted, coffee and some refreshning fruits. The great and temptating aroma.Taste is strongly roasted, espresso, some citrusfruits and lots of bitternss. Some sweetness balancing the dry and roasted taste. Only medium bodied, lots of smooth carbonation. A strongly roasted, almost burned Stout with citrusfruits and strong hoppyness that gives interesting touch.
Bottle 0.5l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki (batch 162). Colour is black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, licorice, coffee and malts. Not bad.
Dark brown black with medium head. No sweet aroma but with chocolate and coffee notes. Some taste af dark fruits and berries in the aftertaste. Roasted finish

500mL from Grassroots in Jax, FL. Pours a clear, deep maroon. Larger mocha foam. Rockier head. Good retention. Webby lacing. Nose is fruity- jammy blackberry, raspberry jam on toast. Taste is pretty thin and ashy, so much different than their ruggporter. Metallic, ashy, dirty. No body. Tea heavy. WTF? Disappointing.

500ml bottle @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo.Nice coffee aromas. Pours really dark, opaque, with nice tan head, cremay and persistent, good lacing. Medium to full body, cremay texture, soft cabonation. Taste is quite bitter, malty, coffee and cacao flavours, well balanced. Long aftertaste. Nice one.
Pours black with a nice tan lasting head and good lace. Aroma malts, fruit. Taste is sweet malt, coffee, light chocolate, some bitterness lively carbonation dry sweet finish.

Bottle at ChrisO Snow tasting, thanks to Henrik, 20/01/13.

text: UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 Black beer with nice head on top which leaves some lacing. Aroma has salty licorice, roasted malts. Taste is roasted and a bit salty, licorice. Not that sweet. Oily body and low carbonation.

Bottle at ChrisO Snow tasting, thanks to HenrikO. It pours very dark brown with a massive light tan head. The nose is dark fruit, roasted malt, treacle, cherry, blackcurrant, toast and faint spice. The taste is roasted malt, prune, plum, date, raisin, earth and chocolate. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well balanced. A solid stout.

Bottle at the ChrisO Snow Tasting, London - thanks to whoever brought this one! Pours rich brown with a creamy, tan head. Sugary dark malt nose, light spices. Medium sweet flavor, lightly roasty with dry and dark sugars, light dirt. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Moderate warmth to finish, dirty bitterness, dark cocoa, burnt leaves. Good all around stout.
Bottle at Chriso Snow Tasting.  Black beer lasting tan head. choccy aroma. very flavoursome choccy sponge. pleasant

Aroma is nice in a wierd way, i guess its the hops that are messing with my nose. Black with beige head. Smooth chocolate and medium bitterness. Finish is long and hippy. Medium body. Perfect for a stout - imperial part
Bottle. Black with a small head.Smokey and slightly dry. Medium body and very easy to drink. Impressive.

500ml bottle from Archive. Pours as black as the deepest darkest depths of space and carries a good crown of coffee coloured foam. Bitter chocolate and roasted malt aroma. Fills the mouth with bitter liquorice and faint vanilla flavour. Long lingering finish on the palate.

From a 500ml bottle on 17/12/2012 (Batch Number 420, BB 02/2015). Pours close to black with a smallish head. Has quite a big chocolate and caramel aroma. This stout is big on flavour with heaps of dark chocolate, licorice, some caramel, and roasted malt to burn. The sweetness up front is quickly overtaken by a quite wonderful, long, massive bittermess where both lashings of hops and burnt malt are evident. The palate is slightly creamy and the carbonation a touch higher than average. Fru Frederiksen is one formidable and quite impressive lady!

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2012 50 cl bottle, bbe 07/17. Black with a brown head. Butter, chocolate, light sourness, light roasted aroma. Flavor has chocolate, wheat, roasted, almost burnt malt. Sweetish finish. Not bad, easy to drink.

Bottle 50 cl. Batch 162, BBE 07/2017. Light roasted coffee, some sweetrr chocolate and something in the vein of some sour element, cant really describe what is on this case. Roasted malts, some mix of sweet licorice and chocolate in taste.
Pours thick, black and syrupy. Aroma is full of chocolate, coffee and treacle. Body could be fuller. Flavour is very well balanced, bittersweet.

Black color, offwhite foam.
Immediate licorice , Roasted aromas, choclate & cocoa and some vanilla.
Full body  high complexity.
Well balanced & very enjoyable

Pours pitch black color with a small head. Aroma of rye, mild oat, dark roasted malts, cocoa and chocolate. Flavour of cocoa, roasted malts@ chocolate, ripe dark fruits and some licorice. Mildly bitter palate, full-bodied, sweet chocolaty finish. Excellent.

Pours almost black with low head. Aroma is roasted malts, hops, fruits and AIV-food. Flavor is coffee, hops, roasted malts. Dry finish. Almost swell!

0,5 l bottle @ Harrys. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with some fruits. Flavor is roasted malts, some fruits and a hoppy finish. More like black IPA, but quite enjoyable nevertheless.
Fra fat på Cardinal: en yppig og velproposjonert men allikevel blid danske. Hvornaar smager denne best? Alltid. Danmark er dejligt.

Was looking forward to this but a bit too sweet and fruity for my taste.  Tons of malt, vanilla, touch of coffee, and lots of prune and raisin.  Definitely can distinguish its Danish roots.  Missing some aggressive hops for added complexity.  A little cloying.  Good not great.

Bottle in trade from Suttree. Sweet! Black, with a frothy light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, raisin, wood, licorice, and coffee. Quite bitter, and full of woody coffee flavor and sharp roast; the rich malty sweetness that I expected is very subdued. Medium bodied and slightly harsh with smooth carbonation and substantial dryness. Good stout. Definitely best once it reaches full room temperature.

Draught at Ørsted Bar. Dark reddish brown with a foamy beige head. Smooth sweet roasted nose, vanilla, grapefruit. Flavor is sweet, hard roasted malts, licorice, chocolate, fruity, citrusy hops. Semi dry bitter finish. Well balanced and very easy drinkable....

Pours a viscous dark chocolate brown color that appears pitch black and completely opaque in the glass with a two finger beige head that slowly settles into a lasting cap/ring. Streaks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Surprisingly hop forward aroma for the style with a strong earthy pine presence thats countered by sweet and roasted dark malts. Prominent spicy, grassy hops with hints of pine needle and spruce tip followed by dark chocolate, caramel, coffee bean and toast. As it warms, the malt characteristics come to the forefront but it still has too strong of a hop presence for my preference. 

On the fuller end of medium bodied with a strong earthy hop presence that slightly overpowers the complex malt profile. Dry and bitter with lots of resinous pine and spicy, grassy hops that linger over the sweet and roasted notes into a bone dry finish. As it warms, the malts become stronger with hints of burnt toast, dark chocolate, robust coffee bean, caramel, toffee and oatmeal but the hop bitterness still dominates. A bit one dimensional with lots of bitterness and almost acrid roasted malt. The ABV is well masked but it could use some sweetness for balance. This is supposed to be a toned down Hr. Frederiksen but I find it tougher to drink.

0.5 L bottle.  A finger of tan cream head, upon a translucent deep ruby brown body. Inviting chocolate aroma. Delicate milk-chocolate with a dry/powdery touch. Also some gently roasted dark malts, faint tinned fruits, and some subtle vanilla tones.  More than medium full. Smooth and velvetly in the mouth. Soft, light sparkling carbonation. Taste is more powerfull than the aroma indicate. There is a generous amount of bold bittering hops in here, and lots of well roasted dark malts. Flavors of burnt caramel, bitter coffee/chocolate, a mellowing malt-sweetness, and a fine note of vanilla. A nicely balanced, complex and well crafted beer.

Bottle. Brown with frothy light brown head. Lots of coffee and chocolate, roasted malt, light anise and alcohol, bit of fruit, for some odd reason oak. Moderate body and low carbonation, becomes dry, lots of chocolate on the finish and a very nice depth as well.

(Bottle). Big aroma of roasted malt with hints of coffee. Taste of roasted malt and coffee. Vaguely bitter aftertaste. I think this beer is pretty boring, but because of the good ratings it has maybe I should try it again.

Bottle (500 ml). Black with a medium creamy brown head and some lacing. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is sweet with chocolate, roasted malt and a slight bitter finish. Mouthfeel is velvety. Very good stout and good use of the hops in this beer. Superb balance and nice drinkability for the style.

Bottle.
Pours black with high creamy brown head. Some lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla. Taste is of chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, sweet. Overall: good body, very sligth bitter finish.

A-- Poured a dark cola color, almost black. Medium pour got a large head that quickly receded to a root beer float colored head and level. Left spotty lacing through the entire glass. Very good head retention to this. Just little flashes of carbonation on the sides of the glass. 

S-- Roasted malts, roasted barley, fresh roasted coffee, warm chocolate. Nice warm, inviting smell to this. Does get a little soft at times though.

T-- Coffee/ espresso grounds, coco powder, and lots of roasted malt. Almost to the point of over roasted. 

M-- Bitter but smooth. Lots of bitter coffee/ espresso grounds in this. For as bitter as it is, it is still quite soft in the back and a little bit of acidity as well. Good touches of carbonation. Bitterness makes this a high medium feel and medium carbonated. 

D-- Tasty stout. Well hidden ABV and a sipper due to the amount of bitterness in this. Bigger and bolder than what I expected. Well made beer.

Bottle shared at Ørsted Ølbar.  Pours brown, almost black with a tan head.  Aroma is roasted, coffee, chocolate and biscuit, smooth and nice but not intense.  Flavour matches aroma with a nice mellow and balanced medium sweetness and bitterness that is easy going but full of flavour.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

The aroma is very nice with toasted malt, coffee, chocolate, hay, and molasses. The appearance is dark brown with a smaller head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is thin. Overall this one comes really close to being really good.
Poured from a bottle. Notes of chocolate, roasted malts, fruity, and slightly nutty. A very tasty stout.
Thanks to aaron for this beer. Bitter roasty and dusty flavor. Aroma is roasty but a bit weak. An ok beer.

Pour out of 22 oz is dark black with tan head aroma has notes of sour berry, grain, biscuit, coffee, chocolate, caramel, and dark fruit. Taste is nice red berry, sour, hints of chocolate cordial, some grain, toffee, finishing dry but sweet.

Bottle @ Dans house. Deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Burnt roasty malty, somewhat red fruity, a bit smoky aroma. Tangy, raspberry/cranberry, burnt roasty malty, a little peaty smoky flavor. Pretty interesting.

I stort sett helt svart öl med fluffigt härligt skum. En vacker öl. Doftar lätt rostat med en maltig sötma och mörk choklad. Det finns både rostade toner och humle i smaken men ingen av dessa tar över. Det är en elegant och harmonisk öl, men med mycket smak och en härligt tjock oljig munkänsla.
black, clear, minimal head, tan foam, coffee, roasty, toast, soy sauce, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,
black, brown foam, chocolate, coffee, roasty, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, heavy cloying sweetness, very bitter,

A powerful new world stout of the highest order. Pours with an amazingly fluffy ice cream sunday head. Really pretty. Deeply flavoured nose with sweet roast and clear cut dark chocolate. Good penetration here. Roast and chocolate takes a back seat in the palate as the hops come through. Not at all over powering but it does straighten / tighten the flavours. Soft, elegant finish.

Brown black pour with tan head. Aroma is light coffee, some chocolate, and some roasted malt. Sweet chocolate, a bito abv, a bito malt bitter, roastiness, and some hop bite. Medium bodied but a tad fizzy.

Bottle at Ølbutikken. Pours black with a tan head. Smells of hops, coffee and some minor hints of red berries. Tastes a heavy sweet and strong espresso bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Finishes a semisweet oily bitter with a long duration.

Almost black body and stable brown head. Milk chocolate, butter milk, sticky figs and wholewheat bread. Delicate but complex. Full bodied (with good lacing) and again a delicate but sufficient rich. Little bit of bitterness coming though to compliment. No alcohol yet truly full texture. Well made imperial stout (at a regular stout abv). (50cl bottle)
En kraftig och smakrik öl. Choklad och humle. En tydlig beska som skapar balans.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, peat, dough and licorice.  Nice.  Very dark brown that sits jet black in the glass with an average light tan head that mostly diminished and left great lace.  Flavor is very sweet and medium/heavy bitterness.  Palate is medium/full bodied and watery soft.  Overall a really nice stout.  Great aroma and flavor that really shows off the chocolate and roasted malt profile.  The hops are very well balanced and do not overpower the finish with bitterness.  A very good stout that is right up there with Bells Kalamazoo stout.  Just loved it.

In short: A stout with a bit of everything you can expect from the style.  Very good
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed when approximately one year before expiration date
The look: Translucent black body topped by a small beige head
In long: Nose has a bit of everything for the style, roast, raisins, chocolate, coffee beans, hops resin.  Taste is more of the same, once again with all of the most common flavor elements found in stouts.  Roast, coffee, raisins, a slice of chocolate cake, soft black liquorice candy, toasted oat (although I dont if any oat is actually used).  Just the perfect amount of herbal resinous hops to balance the beer.  This is a 7% beer that drinks like a 5% session stout.  A very sessionnable big stout, too easy to drink if you ask me, because every week-end when I wake up I find a bunch of empty beer bottles around my couch that I dont remember drinking.  The only reasonable explanation: my couch has a drinking problem.

500 ml bottle from El Irlandés. Pours an attractive dark brown, almost black color with a big tan head that shows good retention. Aroma is strongly malty, roasted with mocha, cocoa, medium roasted coffee grains and toasted rye bread. Some lactose hints too. Flavor is strong on coffee grains, dense and smooth, very oaty. In the back, complimenting the roastiness there are nice grassy hops increasing the complexity of this wonderful stout. A Breakfast Stout for sure, closer to Mikkeller Beer Geek Breakfast than what you would think. Less hoppy though with the hops more camouflaged in the palette of flavors. Smooth big body with more carbonation than your typical strong Stout. Dry in the finish with a low dose of astringency. Another excellent danish beer. Brilliant! And cant wait to try the Hr. Frederiksen.
A vers good with roasted and oaklike flavors. Nice rotundes with Nice bitterness. Vers Dark ón ColorSync with a lasting White head.

Aroma of black coffee, dark soy beans, and roasted barley.  Pours black with some decent white lacing.  Tastes very bitter with roast barley coming through and a hint of anis.  Very dark and a little harsh but definitely a strong stout.  I just wasnt feeling this one.
Black, with a thick, creamy brown head. Smells like coffee and chocolate, plus some blackberry or something like that. Flavor is more of the same - coffee, chocolate and some lightly fruity notes.
Kolsvart imperial stout med lite lättare kropp. Lite syrligt vinös, soja, kaffe, lakrits och katrinplommon. Torr, lite stramare finish med en lätt rökig och lakritskaraktär. Kalasgod.
Thanks to whomever brought this bottle to the Orange County beer society tasting.  This black pour was roasty, smokey and tasty.

Bottle from De Gekraakte Ketel web shop. Almost black color with huge beige head. Aroma of dried plums, coffee, dark chocolate, alcohol. Taste, coffee, dark fruits, vanilla, chocolate. Nice bitter finish. Nice beer.
Very good Stout. One of the best I have tasted. Nevertheless, this has not the level of a master Imperial Stout.

Flavors of dry earthy cocoa, berries with cream, ash, dirty orange, dark coffee and plum. Medium-heavy body has medium carbonation and is slightly sticky, but finishes dry with acidity from both hops and roast.

500 ml bottle. Black pour good mocha head. Loads of roast, coffee, and sweet/bitter cocoa. Great mouthfeel, good body, perfect carb. Velvet finish, more sweet roast, cocoa, espresso, and some sweet malt. Solid stout!

Bottle @ Home. Pours black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, raisins and other dark dried fruit.  Taste is Taste is roasted malt, coffee, licorice, some weak dark fruit flavors aswell. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry roasted finish. 011011

Bottle....pours pitch black with medium tan head..... the aroma is caramel, roasted coffee and some chocolate... flavor is tobacco, chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Full bodied and creamy. Very nice!! :) love it ! ...
Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Nose and taste of roast chocolate and black malt, vanilla, hazelnut coffee and light tinge of black licorice in the finish. Light to medium body.

Lots of dark malt aroma. Hints of coffee and slight vanilla aromas. Pours deep black with rich light brown head. Wow! Lots of dark malt flavor. The dark roast flavor is very nice. Very rich and dry at the same time.  The lingering roast malt astringency is actually very pleasant. This is a thoroughly enjoyable beer. This beer needs some soft stinky cheese to go with it. Wonderful!

Bottle from Ølbutikken, shared with Palme and the Bergen Tasting Crew. First out among the Fredriksen series up for rating is Fru Fredriksen; the lightest of the lot. Pours a black body with a big caramel head. Coffee, licorice, black berries and hints of dark chocolate hits my nostrils in a very pleasant way. Taste is equally smooth; mellow coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts and hints of black berries and grassy hops blend elegantly on my tongue. This is very nice, although a certain sticky malt sweetness cloys it up a bit after a while. Still, a very solid stout from Amager.

0.5l bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen shared with ClubGonzo and the rest of Bergen Tasting Crew. She pours a black body with a nice creamy lacing chocolate head. Aroma is really fruity and somewhat sweet, packed with melon and raspberries, black currants and notes of light chocolate and hops. Not really anything reminding me of a stout here, but I really like it and nothing like what I expected at all. Its average to soft carbonated, has a oily mouthfeel and medium to full-bodied. Nice roasted flavors with notes of chocolate, more roasted -almost burned- malts, hints of vanilla extract and it has a nice and almost fruity and hopy finish. Not bad at all this gal!

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black colour stout with a large light brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light lactose notes with some dry roasted malt and some black chocolate. Taste is an interesting mix between some black chocolate and some dry roasted malt which are offset by some light lactose notes. Body is above average with good carbonation and a somewhat creamy texture. OK though I prefer the imperial version better.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2011 A slightly watered down but amazing version Hr Frederiksen. I really like what the dutch do with their stouts, is it in the water, or the yeast strain, or malt treatment? Its a charming licorice type flavor, much more dominant in the Hr version. Great brew.

A lasting, delicious tan head settles over the blackness. Uncompromising aroma for a 7% brew, feeling bigger than its real strenght. Coffee roast and liquorous berry-like fruitiness dominate subtler rooty, woodsy, spicy undertones and a fair bit of earthiness. The gentle residual sugars never limit drinkability, alcohol is kept well under control. This makes for a drinkable, albeit substantial, softly oily brew. A more than honest leafy, lightly citrusy and almost green bitterness closes it all, hands in hands with the roast and adding a bright freshness to the ensemble.

My Bottom Line :  
This Stouts voluble dark malts develop coffee, raisins, roast and chocolate for a diverse and comfortable example of the style. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A slice of foam decorates the brown-edged blackness. 
-The malt display is reminiscent of Hill Farmsteads wondrous Everett!
-The body is silky, wealthy but not heavy. 
-The finish is almost soft, especially considering the talkative nature of the malt profile. Makes it all the more drinkable, actually.
-Light licorice creates even more depth.
-Resinous hops tag along the roasted malts in the bitterness and aftertaste. Residual sugars dont envelop this finish, which is appreciated.
-This is yet another excellent dark brew from Amager!

bottle at wlv, had next to the hr... this is a simpler thinner version of the hr, but I like i better, hr is too ashy, this is more drinkable

Bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 22.4.2010. Great, well balanced stout with a lot of roasted malts and notes of oats and hops.

The notes of anise and licorice in the taste and aroma, that were more present when the beer was colder, are not very much to my liking.  A little warmed up, I must say this is a terrificly well balanced and wonderfully complex brew.  Coffee, chocolate, dried fruits, caramel and a lasting hoppiness make this beer very interesting. Schokoladiger, dunkelmalziger Übergang zu einem kräftig bitterschokoladigen Mittelteil. Im Hintergrung fruchtige Noten. Im Abgang malzig, weniger süß, dafür kraftvoll trocken und bitter. 
Äußerst gutes Stout. Begeisternd!

A decent stout. Slightly sour on the nose with LOTS of chocolate. THin to medium body. Lots of chocolate and a pinch of espresso with a bitter coffee finish. Very coating on the mouth. Nice, but I would stick with beer geek breakfast.
Bottle shared by little Nicky.  Black pour with a creamy head.  Roasty aroma with a bit of fruit, chocolate and funk.  Similar flavor.  Pretty good stuff!

Bottled 500ml. -Deep black coloured, big brown head, intensive roasty nose. Heavy roasted malt, dried fruits and licorice with notes of hops and chocolate. Bitter finish and long-lasting aftertaste. Enjoyable stout.
Bottle. Black with a nice beige head. Aroma and flavour of coffe, chocolate, roasted malt, fruit and hops.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest
Nagyon mély fekete színe van, teljesen átláthatatlan. Habja hatalmas, világos barna, kemény és szivacsos, tele van buborékokkal és szinte örök életű. Illata betölti az egész szobát, minőségi kávélikőr, csokoládé puding ami konyakba áztatott meggyel van díszítve. Az egész olyan, mintha egy drága cukrászda konyhájában szimatolnánk a levegőbe. Ez az ízben is szépen jelentkezik, mintha egy alkoholos meggyel töltött, fekete csokoládéval készült tömény süteménybe harapnánk. Aztán jön egy jó adag finom, friss kávé, egy kis édeskés dohány, sötétre sütött zabkeksz és komló. Olajos és sűrű teste van és csípős kis buborékokkal van tele. Utóíze keserédesen, kissé alkoholosan kezdődik, ami a végén teljesen kiszárítja a szánkat és igen hosszan tart. Fantasztikus egy ital, hosszú estéken, lassan kortyolgatva kell fogyasztani, megérdemli a figyelmet.

Bottle. Black with a large light tan head that settles to an inch and laces extravagantly. Aroma has cocoa, vanilla, roast, smoke, seaweed. Silky mouthfeel. Taste is mildly sweet with dark sugars, chocolate and burnt coffee; roasted and pine hop bitterness, a little smoke and a fair whack of salt. Packs a lot of flavour in but narrowly remains a drinker not a sipper. Not a cuddly stout.

Black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Smooth and full bodied. Excellent. 070510

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours damn well pitch black with a small, dense, tan head.  The nose is very roasty with nice coffee notes and perhaps a bit of soapy hops.  The flavor starts off slightly fruit, then moves to lightly hoppy, slightly sweet (caramel), roasty, and finishes a bit earthy and flinty.  Interesting transition.  None of the flavors are overwhelming or powerful.  Just a nice, easy transition from one to the next.  The finish seems a bit dull though.  Medium to rich body with low carbonation leading to a slightly roasty, almost flat finish.  I have to say I had high expectations for this brew, but it just sort of sits there.  I do appreciate the smoothness and evenness in taste.  Its nice and all, just not outstanding.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a light creamy head. Aroma has lots of deep fruit notes, dark berries, slightly roasted and a bit of hops, as well as liquourice and a dash of alcohol. Taste is rather big with a nice liquorice-feel, darkly roasted characteristics, very soft and velvety. Also lots of cream and milk chocolate.

black, clear w/ steady bubbles and frothy brown head
dominant smell is alcohol, followed by a burnt coffee aroma
med body and fairly fizzy. not very thick for 7%
main taste is burnt coffee. the alcohol doesnt come through much in flavour. there is a slight tart yeastiness and some red fruit like raspberries
very nice. a serious stout!

Pours black with a nice light brown head. Aroma has coffee, hops, roast, very creamy, chocolate. Taste has a good amount of nice roast, coffee, some hops, hints of vanilla and sweet chocolate, worty sweetness, milk coffee creamer, slightly astringent finish.

Dark brown coloured. Has an off-white head, fully lasting. Aroma is heavy malty, toasted, caramel, milk chocolate, moderate hoppy, herbal. Heavy sweet flavor, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Pours dark brown with a brown head. Nice strong coffee and chocolate aroma. Light sweetness and light bitterness. Smooth light body with an easy drinking finish. Flat like a dry irish stout.

A chocolate milkshake coloured head large good strength carbonation very dark stout good retention aroma coffee mocca like liccorice dark fruit rich chocolate cocoa coming through mild flavour liccorice dry cocoa chocolate light fizz fruit taste dark and sweet palate friendly sweetness of grain finish good malt taste rich dry hop fruit lasting bitter okay
Dark brown; reddish edges; thin sawdusty head. Woody licorice aroma. Flavor - lots of licorice. Long woody finish. Real nice.

Bottle 500ml shared courtesy of meilby. Pours very dark brown with light tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee, chocolate, bit of hops. Taste is sweet and slightly bitter, medium duration. Medium body, oily, soft carbonation.

Bottle 500ml @ home
[Trade by fonefan] Pours very dark reddish brown with a off-white to tan head. Aroma has notes of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and light hops. Taste is medium sweet and bitter with an average finish with hints of licorice. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle on New Years, paired with Hr. Frederiksen.

A bit of sweet chocolate in the nose and some peat smoke characteristic. A medium body, slightly leaning towards thick, with a fairly uncommon flavor profile for a stout of this kind, aforementioned peat smoke mixing with some surprisingly strong hop bitterness (bottle is probably near the end of its life).  Middle of the road, or perhaps a bit better, for a stout.

Bottle.  Pours with the visual appeal of old motor oil.  The aroma is killer ... plain old strong coffee.  Very nice java and licorice flavors with a distinct grainy undertow.  Beauty of a stout.  Delicious.  (#4035, 12/13/2010)
From a bottle poured a dark brown color with almost no head.  Sweet toasted malty flavor with a quick finish.

500mL bottle, pours black with a medium beige head. Roasted malts, oats and light espresso on the nose. Flavour is essentially the same, with a dry body and a slightly bitter finish. Looking forward to trying this ones big brother.

An amazing stout, with great bitterness and drinkability.  Pours absolutley dark with off-white creamy head, with thick lace following.  Milk chocolate brown coloured body and romas, along with the roast.  Creamy and above average mouthfeel.  Very tasty, and the 75 IBU kicks in the finish which made it great with food. Premiere Gourmet.

Bottle.  Near black with a beige foam.  Aromas are marzipan with peat and coffee.  Chocolate with winter fruit.  Woody, spicy hops.  Obvious alcohol with melon and liquorice.  Flavours are dry and woody with nutty notes.  Berries and yeast with chocolate.  Toffee with molasses and marzipan.  Decent.
Bottle.  Almost black beer with a strongish light brown head.  The aroma is vinous and spiced, and the flavour is bitter with a vinous spiced tinge.  Overall a good spiced and bitter beer.
Quite light mouthfeel, notes of coffee and roast. Very easy to drink. Good balance between being full of flavour and still being easy to drink.

500ml Bottle (Thanks Svesse) - Very dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malt, liquorice, marzipan and some hoppy hints in the aroma. Roasted and slightly hoppy taste with notes of plain chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and liquorice. Very enjoyable.
Bottle. Very dark brown with a lacing tan head. Espresso and chocolate aroma. Solid roast, but also mild notes of chocolate flavours. A very well-crafted beer.

[3213-20100731] Bottle. Roasted malt aroma has a lightly smoked note. Dark brown body with a quick bubbly white head. Roasted plum malt flavour has a hint of a coffee finish. Medium-full body. Good.
(@ ChrisOs Pre-GBBF 2010, London, England)

50cl bottle. Pours a dark brown/black color with a beige head. Long lasting foam. Aroma is malty and roasted with licorice notes but weel mixed with some hoppy resiness and spiciness. Taste is similar: quite strong malty roasted presence mixed with pint notes. Dry bitter finish. Good carbonation and palate. Overall, quite hoppy for a stout, but very enjoyable.

500 mL bottle shared by Butters at the 12th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 9/18/10. Pours a dark brown color with a medium tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of chocolate, lightly roasted malts, leafy hops and plumlike fruit notes. The taste is milk chocolate, cocoa powder, minty hops, caramel and faint fruity notes. Very dessert like. Very nice beer. Medium bodied.

Draft @ Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma with some hoppy hints. Roasted malty chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee and chocolate finish with a bitter aftertaste.

Bottle brought back from Atlanta (greens) by mitchgt.  Big coffee and chocolate aroma.  Nice crisp hoppy cocoa taste.  great balance.  perfectly typical stout.  Dunno...  all I had from my notes.  Seemed to like it though.
Sweet caramel, toffee aroma. Lots of caramel, vanilla, coffee and toffee in the flavor. Chewy mouthfeel, residual bitterness. Very dry and oaky. Slight booze in the finish.

Pours black with dark brown heavy head leaving lacing on the glass. Suprisingly mellow aroma of malts and hay. Fruity, acidy tart flavor. Full bodied on palate. Finish is nicely tart combined with slight sweetness.

Draught. Black with a large, creamy light brown head. Aroma: chocolate, some coffee, roasted, hops, citrus. Taste: quite a high bitterness, grapefruit, fruit, dark bitter chocolate, some coffee. Full, slightly fizzy mouthfeel.

On-tap. Bishops Arms Järntorget, Porterveckan. Black colour with a beige head. Roastiness, floral & citric hops, coffee, licorice, light sweetness, alcohol, bitter finish, maybe a bit on the thin side for a 7% stout. Decent, but I´m personally getting bored with hoppy, citric, alcoholic stouts.

22 oz. bottle.  Almost black with some red and a thick tan head that is one finger after a vigorous pour into a tall glass.  The aroma is delicious chocolate but it doesnt last long.  Flavor surprises me with biting and bitter hops up front.  Those hops settle in a  bit and that rich chocolate emerges.  Some dark fruit along with citrus.This doesnt seem to be barrel aged but some wood and vanilla are noted.  Aftertaste is espresso with spicy hops.  Feel is rich, smooth, and creamy.
Sample at SBWF 2010. Black with a tanned head. Dark fruits, roasty malts, some coffee and bourbon. Medium body, light carbonation and some hops freshing it up in the end.

Bottle. Pours with an essentially black body with a lasting tan head. Aromas of mocha, milk chocolate, cinnabun, dusty cocoa powder, licorice, raisins, currants, figs, dark fruits (misc.), coffee, vanilla and light leather. Flavors are dusty and earthy, tons of raw (dusty) cocoa powder, leather, vanilla, light lactose, dark fruits, and earth. A really well crafted stout! Livelish bubbles for the style. Long duration. Creamy. Mild alcohol flavors. Very well done!
10/1/10.  Thanks, darn1207!  Sweet, smokey aroma.  Sweet chocolate flavor with cocoa, vanilla, and more.  Nice!

500ml bottle as a sweet bonus from foppa78. thanks, mat! pours a dark, cola-brown with a thin, bubbly, khaki head and a tight ring of lace. aroma is great, pretty unique, with strong, dark chocolate, roast, and charcoal with interestingly sweet, fruity notes of plum skins and berry backed by light coffee and topsoil. flavor is excellent as well with loads of smooth oatmeal, roast, and cocoa powder up front backed by cold coffee, earth, cigar ash, and licorice with the slightly tart notes of plum from the aroma showing up late in the sip. palate is medium bodied with solid carbonation and a bitter, chalky, ashy finish. overall,  a damn nice stout.

Bottled.  Poured clear, deeper brown with a well-retained tan head.  The aroma picked up sweeter coffee and chocolate notes with mild roast to em.. accents of vanilla and biscuits.. well-balanced and enticing.  The flavor found more of the coffee and lesser bakers chocolates at the core.. roasty coffee bitterness on the edges.. dry, earthy bitterness joined coffee roast on the finish.. tasty.  Medium-bodied, but empty at times on the palate.. carbonation was moderate and where it needed to be.. this was a solid brew.

16.9 oz bottle.  Dark brown with a creamy beige head.  Nose is coffee, grain, hay and light chocolate.  Milky medium body with a tingle.  Taste is coffee bean, chocolate and licorice with some grassy hops to balance.  Solid sessionable stout.

From Butters @ 12th Richmond Gathering. Poured a dark, medium-heavy  body. The aroma is heavy on the coffee. Taste is also heavy on the coffee, in addition to the noticeable centennial hops on the finish. Interesting stout, definitely one of the hoppier ones out there.

From Butters @ 12th Richmond Gathering: Charcoal aroma with black chocolate hints. Clear, dark mahogany, tan medium head, good lacing. Tobacco and black chocolate flavor. A wisp of smoke in the finish. Full body, well rounded, good mouthfeel. Delicious. No wonder the Danes pwn this site!

Bottled courtesy of the brewers and Papsoe whom I thank oh so very much again. Poured a black body with a tan head. Sweet chewy malty nose, nicely sweet, soft fruity notes. Soft creamy malty taste, tiramisu, some alcohol pops up when it warms. Light bitterish notes. Nicely balanced.

Bottle courtesy of butters at the 12th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 09/18/2010. Dark brown body with a small creamy tan head. Sweet coffee, roast and chocolate aroma. Sweet roast, chocolate, and malty flavor. Medium light body with moderate carbonation.

Sampled at the Richmond Gathering XII. Pours a very dark brown with dark tan head and chestnut highlights. Nose is sweet roasty chocolate.  Very creamy chewy body.  A little raisin, black malts, burnt. Very nice

(Sample Date: 9/18/2010   Source:Butters)   Chocolate and dark malts with hint of astringency in aroma. Almost black with small fine off white head. Sweet malty with some smokiness. Light warming and smooth. Medium body and mouth. Finish is lightly bitter and warming. Excellent.

500 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu. Rated @ 22.4.2010.
Pours a beautiful pitch black colour with a massive brownish head. Nice lacing too. Maximum points for the appearance. Aroma is slightly hoppy and malty.  Hops and malts kick in on the flavour with citrus and chocolate notes. Smooth mouthfeel. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Long finish. Mrs. version is a nice light version of Mr.

Pours a nice warm opaque sable with a thick, fine-bubbled, light tan head that sticks around for a while. Aroma is strongly of molasses and miso, with hints of chocolate and smoke. Flavor is rather sweet, but not cloying, and has nutty, molasses, smoky, caramel and chocolate components as well as a hint of coffee and a bit of hoppy bitterness. Fairly thick texture is rather smooth and fizzy, leaving behind a nice tingle.

Bottle: Batch 114:
Very big brown foamy head, disappears slowly.
Beer color is black.
Smell coffee, liquorice, raisin, caramel, roasted malts, tar, meat and hint of chocolate.
Taste roasted malts, coffee, hints of brown sugar, hints of liquorice.
Light grassy and well bitter (not dry) aftertaste.
Very well balanced, low carbonation, silky on the tongue and a big body!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: dark bread, caramel,chocolate,black, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

From the Bottle at Chris Os pre GBBF tasting, Kensal Rise 31/07/2010
Hoppy aroma. White head. Dark coloured and a little rich on the palate with some alcohol present. A hint of bitterness and dryness in the finish.
Pours a thick black colour with a creamy brown head and lacings. Nose is roasted malts and hops.

2010-07-31. Black body, small foamy beige head. Aroma is alcoholic, muted dark malt. 6+ Flavour is milder than expected, dark malt, light roasty accents. 6+ Average palate. Enjoyable but surprisingly mild actually. Bottle at ChrisOs Pre-GBBF Shindig 2010"Do you reckon that fonefan bloke seriously likes phones???" - Overheard

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured pitch black with a huge, beige head. Lots of roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate, raisins, and hops in the aroma. Medium dense and carbonation. Slightly sweet finish that ends with a hoppy aftertaste. Excellent beer!

I love when I trade overseas for a bottle and then 8 months later it shows up at the local bottle shop. Of course if I hadnt traded for it it never would have made it here for others to enjoy. A subtle roasty and slightly sweet stout. I could put away a couple of these in one sitting. Distinct and delicious roast coffee aroma. There is a lot more roastiness in the flavor though with some melted milk chocolate adn a slightly sweet finish. Faint and subtle bitter sweet finish to round everything out.

Bottle. Black beer with a tan head. Toffee and light roast aroma with light chocolate. caramel/toffee flavor with light roast and light chocolate. Medium-plus bodied. Caramel/toffee lingers with light hops and light chocolate.

A Mes rate: Bottle thanks to Jeppe, drank at my mums sometime over Christmas.Pretty much opaque black brown with a good beige head. Amazing aroma, full of big earthy black malt with loads of coffee and chocolate. Similar flavour but it was very slightly soapy and a little on the thin side. Being such a huge fan of Mr. Fred I was hoping for more. Still a damn good beer no doubt but... the boys beat the girls...
Black with a fizzy white head. Sweet malty chocolate aroma and taste. Decent and smooth for a high alcohol content.

500. Pours jet black with a dense, creamy, persistent brown head. Glorious looking beer and totally out of season for a "hot" Seattle summer day...but who cares about seasonality when a beer is this nice? Dense, foamy sheets of lace coming down the sides of the glass. Big chocolate and soy nose, showing a wee bit of coffee as well. Sticky thick body. Tons of grain in this one, low carb. Chocolate, soy, coffee, vanilla, and a bit of dark fruit on the mid palate, with a long sticky sugary coffee finish. Kind of a tweener; neither sessionable nor a demanding sit-down sipper. Has a ton of body, relatively high alcohol, and, while it rewards you with a great deal of complexity, the fact that its on the fence makes it a bit hard to pin down--is it sort of great, or merely really good? Leaning toward really good, myself.

Bottle: As blach as ink, big insoluble tanned head; sweet chocolatey nose, sweaty leather and dried fruits included; full bodied, nevertheless soft and silky; very solid dryish bitter flavour; long and longer drier roasty and fruity finish. Really a great beer.....
port and burnt malt on the nose, quite wide-bodied with a balanced carb. the taste is initially burned malt, plums and coffee and leaves only coffee.

Hon doftar fina, fast inte så starka toner av kaffe, lite syrligt, en aning grädde och en hint av lakrits. Hennes vätska är lagom tjock, beska-balansen är god och hon har en fin och len eftersmak. Jag tycker i det stora och hela att hon är en ganska stabil, fast rätt ordinär stout.

Pours dark brown, halo of tan.  Nose is hard to find...possibly roasty though, with nuts and chocolate.  Body seems very thin and wet..doesnt really hold the flavors well as they come across as diluted roasted malt...palate seems a bit unorganized, but really...this is way too thin and diluted to be considered good in any way

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of roasted malt, light coffee, light chocolate, slight smoke, and slight hops.  Poured extremely dark brown/black in color with a tiny, tan/brown head that lasted around the edges only.  Opaque.  Not sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and medium bitter.  Tastes of roasted malt, pine, hops, slight tar, slight chocolate, light coffee, and some wood.  Medium body.  Dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Roasted malt, hops, light pine, light coffee, slight chocolate, and slight tar finish is medium bitter and dry.

Bottle at home, shared with Erwin. Pours out very dark brown, looks like pitch black at the glass. Very little, to little, head, that wont hold neither it seems. A bit sad. Very good aroma of coffe, lightly chococlate and red fruits inside. Like this one for sure allready. Roasted, very good nespresso- chocolate taste, pretty well balanced biterness and roastiness. Dont ask me why, but I likt this one more then the HR. Frederiksen, wich is pretty good also. But I think this one, for me, seems more balanced at tastes, only a bit sad the head costs some points. Gonna buy more if I can.

(bottle) Coal-black coloured hue with a brown medium-sized foamy head. Sweet and rich roasty malty aroma with notes of dark and milky chocolate, combined with fruity notes of dried berries, noble hops, as well as leather and liquorice-spice. Roasty bitter flavour with a present and well-rounded malty sweetness, full bodied with a very smooth carbonation. Balanced roast-malty and subtle fruity taste with notes of chocolate, burnt caramel, leather and liquorice; dry-ish and intensively roasty and hop bitter finish with light vinous notes and almost the ultimate length. Great. 22.VI.10
Had this one @ CBF 2010. Black colored brew. Roasted malts in the aroma. Flavor is malty, chocolate, roast, coffee. Ok.

500ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki)
