4 refreshing carbonation, crisp at first, but softens on the tongue with the sweet body. Finish continues the hops from the retronasals but they settle down into being quite bitter and dry and almost papery.
15 A really good sipper. We made this last almos an hour and every sip was great.

500ml  bottle from La Cave à Bulles in Paris 
Appearance: Pours a thick black with a tan head, some lacing left in the glass 
Aroma: Roasted malts, dark fruits, chocolate and coffee  
Taste: Roasted malts, smokey (ash), grainy and coffee 
This is a very nice stout. Smooth drinkability.

bottle - black beer with a thick brownish head. Aroma has some coffee and fresh hops notes. Very pleasant coffee and chocolate flavour with a medium bitterness wich balances the maltiness. Medium carbonation. Full body.

Black with a brown head that leaves excellent lacing. Coffee and roasted malts both on the nose and on the tongue. Alcohol is present in the mouth but it is still soft and round. Smooth. Full bodied.
Sampler @ Ølfestival København 2010.

500 ml bottle. Thick brown blackish pour, medium brown greyish head.
Aroma is fruity hops with some earth, peat and liquorice.
Flavour is medium sweetness with a nice bitter backbone of hops, coffee and liquorice. Bitterness lingers of for ages. Very nice.

Bottle at tasting, thanks for sharing dEnk! Pours pitch black with a creamy tan head that laces. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and fruits. Flavor is quite bitter, with pure chocolate, coffee and caramel. Very drinkable yet full bodied stout, nice. Very creamy texture and medium carbonation.
nice smooth beer not unlike other similar beers of its ilk.  Not mindblowing, but very nice and smooth silky slightly higher than average in alcohol content stout.
Black color with a thin head.  Light roasted barley aroma.  And flavor.  Slightly acrid taste.  Very thin bodied and a bit watery.  Just not much happening with this one.

Bottle at Churchkey.  Silky black with a sexy beige head.  Delicate lacing, and nice legs!  Scent of licorice, smoked espresso, nutmeg, and chastity.  She is a bit drier than her husband, more subtle, slightly sweet, with flavors of prunes and grapes, but a spicy edge of black pepper.  Very attractive.

500ml bottle.  Pours a very smooth unsticky near black with a wonderful foamy fizzy light tan airy head.  Aroma accented by a touch of alcohol, super clean roast, no coffee, oats, smoothly floral, plummy, super clean, and thanks to the Amager guys for giving me some insights as to why = ) !  Flavor follows, light bitterness, no coffee, unique bitterness and faint sweetness that reminds me of the plumminess of some trappist beers, oats, super clean.  Medium bodied, smooth with zero stickiness, very well attenuated, beautiful, light sizzling carbonation, very easy drinking.  A delight.

bottle.  mostly black with almost no head and a lifeless appearance.   potent tootsie roll and dark chocolate aroma.  the flavor is also very robust with lots of dark chocolate and that sweet tootsie roll-like flavor.  palate is medium-light for maximum quaffage.

500mL bottle poured into a snifter.

Pours black in the glass with some reddish hints showing through the edges.  The head is small and beige, receding to a small cap with some delicate lacing.

The aroma is dominated by roasted black malts, almost burnt notes, cocoa and a surprisingly noticeable hop presence.  There is a bit more sweetness than the Hr Frederiksen.

The taste is more of the same with some sweet chocolate malts and toasted, smoky black malts combining to form the backbone of the taste with the citrus from the hops layered on top with some dark fruit sweetness as well.

The mouthfeel is medium bodied for the style, though its certainly on the lighter side if youre expecting an impy stout.

This is almost a semi-imperial stout as its got much of the complexity and flavor of an impy stout but with a lighter body.  It makes it seriously drinkable.
50 cl bottle. Dark brown body with tan head. Flavour is roasted malt, dark fruit, chocolate and hops.

Bottle.

Almost black with a good looking large tan head. 

Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and some hops. The same in the taste, also some notes of grass and smoke. Medium body, the finish was long and bitter. A pleasant stout.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2010 50cl, new Danish brew Anno 2008, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex sweet Stout, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew

0,5 l bottle, bought at PreZBF Festival, Belgium.
Poured black with a fantastic foamy, beige head with small bubbles. Deep roasted aroma with a ton of dried fruits, fine espresso-like coffee and molasses, caramel, dark chcolates and a lurking hop perfume. Medium bodied stout witha well rounded, smooth mouthfeel. Flavor is full of coffee, roasted grains, dark chocolates and tobacco, some sweet molasses, nice hops in the finish. Roasted coffe-like, dry aftertaste. Very pleasant.

Bottle.

Very dark brown with a small beige head. Some lacings.

The smell is of chocolate, smooth roasted malts and piny and peppery hops. Hints of coffee as well, and perhaps a faint smoky note. 

The taste has some sweetness to it with notes f roasted malts, chocolate and wood. And again, I get a faint note of smoke. Lots of piny hops. The finish is bitter, but a bit bland aroma-wise with notes of coffee, hops and chocolate. 

Rather light body, smooth and easy to drink. 

Not as in-your-face as Herr Frederiksen and the brewerys regular imperial stout, but theres something about the hop profile in Amagers beers that I dont really like - its too raw, piny and unidimensional.
Black of color with a beige head. An aroma of sweets, liqurice, roasted malt, dark choclate and alcohol. A flavor of roasted malt, chocolate, liqurice and hops.

Bottle. Pours a black liquid with a rather large, beige head. Aroma is very roasted. Taste is rather hoppy with heavily roasted notes and a hint of old cucumber. A bit thin body, and a bit one-sided beer. Not bad, though.

Bottle from systembolaget. Thich light brown head that lasts. Darb brown color. The aroma containes coffey and dark sweet chocolate. In the taste there is coffey and semi dry finnish that then gives the bitterness that is well balanced for this stout. Nice full body.

Bottle, 10C, 2009-12-13, Göteborg
AR: Peach, american hops
AP: Pich black body, heavy steady lasting- high rocky brown head
F: American hops, roasted malt, chocolate, coffey, brown suger sweetness
This was a very nice stout!

Pours a barely transparent dark mahogany with a creamy froth of well-lacing dark beige head.  Aroma of rich dark caramel, chocolate and roasty coffee with some dark fruity complexity.  Starts with good dark malty fullness with some smoky roasted dark chocolate and caramel before a drier, earthy bittersweet finish with lingering dark chocolate.  A very nice stout.

Black colour, tan head some lacing. Aroma is extremely roasted and full of chocolate and coffee. Flavour is the same with a nice bitterness to it. Unfortunately the body is a bit thin and it is very flat as well. This is so much the case that it influences the whole experience of the beer. With a better mouthfeel I would have loved it, now I dont.

50cl Bottle from De Molen. Pitch black, small beige brown head. Aroma of lovely hard roasted malts, lots of chocolate, light smoke/tar, a hint of liquorice. Flavour is sweet and bitter, hard roasted malts, chocolate, lots of hops, earthy liquorice in the bitter finish. Medium to fullbodied, soft and creamy mouthfeel. Fantastic stout, exactly how I like them.

(Bottle at Pikkulintu, Helsinki) Poured black with quite large and light brown head. Aroma was mostly of liquorice and chocolate with some burnt notes. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were roastedness, burtness, ash, hops, bitterness and coffee. Ashy and bitter aftertaste.

Bottle sampled at the DC Local tasting.  Pours an opaque, slightly oily black with a creamy white head.  Nice, toasty aroma, coffee, nuts, brown sugar.  Flavor is also very nice, brown sugar, molasses, coffee, toast.  A little thick in the mouth but drinkable.  Very nice.

50cl bottle, thanks CaptainCougar.  Cola black body atop small tan head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, coffee/roast, some floral, bittersweet chocolate, light earthy.  Taste is moderately sweet, bittersweet chocolate, some coffee, light chocolate syrup.  Smooth medium body.
500mL bottle from DK.Pours black with tan frothy head. Nose of coffee, cinnamon, and grassy hops. Body is creamy and thick. Roasted malts, with very bitter finish which lingers.

At the Ølfestival, Esbjerg, Denmark 22-10-09.   Pours dark brown. Soft creamy roasty flavours show initially. There is a bit of burnt toast on the nose some coffee and a mellow pleasant bitterness, good stuff.  A6 A4 F8 P4 Ov14  3.6
Bottled. Aroma has coffee, chocolate, roast. Black coloured beer with a lasting, beige head. The taste is bitter and sweet and has roast, coffee and chocolate mainly. Hops there as well. Good beer.
DØE Valby 09. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and light liquorish. Flavour is sweet chocolate and roasted malt, coffee. Well balanced.
Bottle. Fairly good stout. Hoppy for a stout. A little thin for all the flavors.
Bottled:Pours black with a mid sized head. Malty and roasted liquorice aroma. Flavour is dry and roasted with a long, hoppy finish.

Bottle.

Pours black with a beige head.

This beer had potential like its husband Mr Frederiksen, all the flavours of coffe and malt is there but the flavour is way too short.

Bottled. Opaque very dark brown, rich firm head. Concentrated roasty licorice aroma. Rathe sweet with medium-fullbody, theres salty licorice and tobacco. Sugary sweetness reduces the drinkability somewhat. The powerful bitterness sets in early and lasts long.

Aroma and taste of snuff, chocolate and coffee. Quite bitter, but not too much. However, the roasted and acidic character ( + a hint of perfume) dominates totally, which kind of ruins it for me. Maybe this bottle wasnt top notch?

It poured a pitch black liquid with a small light brown foam that left just a little bit of lacing.

I was a bit suprised to sense some hops in the smell. However there where also some chocolate, and coffey. I liked the smell.

The taste was a bit watered down though, I would have liked it allot heavier, even for a stout. It had a taste of chocolate, coffey and burned toast. A decent beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a black color with a nice foamy brown head. Aroma of coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate and grassy hops. Flavour is similar with lots of roasted malts, liquorice, dark chocolate, and coffee. Quite hoppy/grassy, with a lingering bitterness. Mediumbodied, dry mouthfeel, with medium carbonation. A very nice stout indeed!

Bottle, 50cl - Opaque dark brown beer with a beige brown head. Aroma is malty with notes of oat, milk, coffee, soy sauce and vanilla. Flavor is malty with notes of roasted grains, some alcohol and chocolate. Very good though a bit too young.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2009 Aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Apperance is dark black with big brown/white head. Flavor is of chocolate,liqurish, coffe and vanilla. Very bitter for a stout. A bit to carbonated maybe.  A very nice stout.

Bottle ࿒ cl) from Systembolaget. Pitch black with a fluffy beige head. Dark chocolate aroma with some tobacco, liquorice, and spicy hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Well balnced with a dry finish. Quite nice.

Bottled. Black with a rich sticky tan coloured foam. Loads of dark chocolate, mild licorice, crisp grassy hops, mild soy and black coffee. Medium to full-bodied with notes of dark chocolate, nut-shells, cracker, bread crusts, roasted malts, ash and mild citrus as it warms up. Long medium-bitter and dryish finish of roasted malts, roasted nuts, crackers, mild licorice and sweet dark chocolate.
Black colour with a creamy brown head. Aroma is roasted malts and and coffee. Flavor is also roasted malts and licorice and some chocolate. Long lasting bitter finish. Good stuff from amager indeed.

Sampled at DØE Beerfestival 2009, Valby. Pours a dark/black beer with a lightbrown head. The aroma is weak with notes roasted malt and coffee. The flavor is coffee, chocolate and roasted malt. The palate is a little bitter, but mostly roasted. The overall impression is a little weak, but with a good flavor.

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a huge dark brown head. The aroma is very roated lending it notes of soy sauce combined with notes of chocolate, but also a light note of alcohol. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of roasted malt, dark sweet chocolate, alcohol, and a bit of bitter hops, leading to a bitter roasted finish, where the alcohol tickles the tongue.

Bottled. Pitch black coloured. Dense brown head. Roast, sweetness, liqourice, light coffee and light herbal touch in the aroma. Flavour of liqourice, roast, light spice sweetness and chocolate. Medium to full bodied. Dry. Roasty and caramelly herbal bitterness in the end. Very nice.
Notes of tobacco and vegetal qualities in admits the general profile of roasted malts, chocolate, etc.  Bottle shared at RBSG 2009 grand tasting.

(500ml bottle)  Pours a dark brown body with a medium beige head.  Aroma of toffee, roasted malt, vanilla, dark fruit, and chocolate.  Flavor of roastiness, caramel, black malt, light fruitiness, black licorice, and some coffee with a bitter finish.

Flaske: Superflot sort øl med et tætsiddende skum. God duft af sød brændt humle, af mangel på en bedre karakteristik. Meget humlet smag, men både chokoladen og den brændte malt træder også frem. Rigtig god øl.
scura densa schiuma media discreta perasitenza note tostate ciocclato caffe luppoli ben presente in bocca le nte tostate tornano buon corpo viscosa ben amara

Bottle at the RBSG09 grand tasting thanks to Papsoe.   Black with a tan head.   Chocolate and super roasty, ashy malt nose.   Chocolate and burnt malt flavor with a dry finish.   Thin in the mouth.   Not one of the better stouts of the night, but still ok.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are coffee, chocolate, roast malt and hops.

RBSG09 bottle at the grand tasting.  Pours almost black with a creamy tan head.  Aromas of dark breads and dark chocolate, with a metallic note.  Flavor is mainly dark chocolate and cocoa powder, with a light roasted coffee character and toffee.  Some mild hop flavors come through with pine, grapefruit, and resin.  Theres a hint of acidity too.  Nice complex beer.
Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2009Black color; big creamy head. Very nice roasted malt aroma, creamy, as well as the flavor, and both aroma and flavor have a good hopping.

(Bottle) Pitch black colour with creamy brown head. Roasted, malty nose with lots of creamy chocolate, a touch of strong black coffe and citrussy hops. Roasted, malty taste with dark chocolate, cocoa, strong black coffee, liquorice and a generous dose of citrussy, coffeeish bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, some sweetness. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Excellent stout (as expected from Amager).

Bottle.Batch 114. Pours dark brown, almost black, with a large frothy tan head.Aroma of distinct roastness, chocolate and hop. Flavour is bitter dark chocolate, coffee, toffee and toast. Lingering aftetaste, dark and bitter. Yummi!

(Bottle) Pours dark brown, super black in the glass with a large fluffy brown head. The aroma heavily roasted and medium burned with hoppy tones of resin, grapefruit, pine and earth. Malt brings notes of new asphalt, burned wood, coal, ash, tobacco, hard roasted espresso, 99% dark chocolate, cocoa powder and brown sugar/dark caramel. Nice dry-ish nose. As the beer gets warmer, you can detect some alcohol. The flavour is light sweet and medium to heavily bitter. Some acidic notes from the roasted malt blend well with the bitter hops. Tones of asphalt, coal, burned coffee beans, dark chocolate, resin, grapefruit, earth, light pine and the slightest touch of dark berries. The mouthfeel is, besides the acidic notes from the malt, surprisingly creamy, oily and smooth with a light to medium carbonation. The finish is salty, light black berry/blueberry fruity and resiny bitter. Nothing fancy about this beer, just vulgar in a good way - like a harmless bodybuilder.

Thanks to MaxxDaddy for sharing.  Wow- this was pretty damn good and actually is very similar to the Hr Frederiksen, just a bit weaker.  Pours a similar very deep oily pitch black with a nice shiny tan head- good lace.  Aroma is typical frederiksen sharp roastiness, wiht good earthy and slight citrus hop notes, big chocolate and a very unique earthy yeastiness with some dark dried fruits.  Flavor is toffee, moderate careml sweetness, lots of coffee and orast barley earth, leather, tar, and tobacco leaf with a big nutty and fruity finish. Awesome 7% stout!

Bottle received via trade with Sahlholdt.  Pours opaque with an average, fizzy, dark brown head, lasting with fair lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (chocolate, coffee, molasses), light hop (herbs), average yeast (leather) with notes of charcoal, prune, and oak.  Full bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Average duration, light sweetness and acidity, moderate bitterness.

An opaque, almost black colored beer, with a big foamy almost brown colored head. The aroma of chocolate with vanilla, coffee and roasted malts. Some fruits. The taste is roasted with sweet chocolate. There are fruits like citrus with raisins and some prunes. Nice bitterness. The aftertaste is dry bitter and it stays for a while.
Bottled. Pours pitch black with a creamy, light brown head. Nose of  malts and vanilla.  Flavour with  roasted malts, burned wood, liquorice and coffee. Full bodied. Burned malty finish.

At CBF 2009, Valby.
Almost black with a brown head. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, chocolate, coffee) and hoppy. Flavor moderate to heavy sweet and bitter (and sour?). Medium to full body.

Tasted with friends @ Alvinne.
The Hr. was better for us.
Almost blackcolor, small deep-beige head. 
Aroma chocolate and coffee.
Full body.
Taste burnt coffee, chocolate; good strong roasted malts bitter ending.
On tap at Orsted. Poured black with a brown head. Aroma consists of chocolate and licorice with a hops in the background. Flavor is complex but not for me.
Black colour with a light brown head. Malty, roasted and light coffee bitter aroma with chocolate sweet notes. Roasted, fruity and coffee bitter flavor with sweet notes.

Very dark almost black with brownish head.
Quite complex and quite hoppy. Very easy drinking for at stout, but calling this a Mrs. does not make it a feminin beer. I really like it.
Thank you, Christian for the birthday present:-) 
I could not help buying Hr. Frederiksen, and tasting (him!?) after this one.

So deep orange-amber that it appears black; deep-beige head. Mix of coffee-like stout aromas, as espresso, and hints of very serious hops - even USA - in the background. Bitterish, burnt coffee, ending on bitter chocolate; good malts preserving sweetness underneath, and a bit of ashes. Bitter finish again, partly hops. Very well-bodied; viscous, seems stronger than 7%. A stout pretending to be an Imperial Stout - one to join the Big Boys!

Bottle at home ... HUGE thanks to Fonefan for this ... deep black with thick tan head ... roast malt and coffee nose  ...slightly fizzy ... deep roast ... smooth chocolate malts ... little meaty ... little toffee licorice ... low bitterness ... creamy and rich ... quite sublime
Basically a lighter version of HR wich,  put simply, is good. Its fairly light bodied yet packed with nice chocolate flavour, hops and a smokey touch. Quite lovely really.

Botella. Pitch black colour with a very nice creamy light brown well alsting head. Very pleasant aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Very good mouthfeel. The flavour has a very pleasant roasted maltiness and with chocolate, coffeeand liquorice followed by a pleasant bitter roasty malty chocolate long lasting finish. More please!

Bottle. Black and beautiful with a dense light brown fro. Aromas of hops, licorice, coffee, oat and tar. Smooth and oily texture. The flavour is licorice, bitter hops, tobacco and roasted malts. Well made and rich stout.

Bottle shared by faroeviking. I have been looking forward to this for a long time and was not dissapointed. Opague black with a dense brown head. Caramel, roasted coffee and some chocolate in the nose. Flavour is tobacco, tar, chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Full bodied and creamy. Very delicious! Great job Amager guys.

Bottle shared by faroeviking. 
Pours dark brown with a small dense light brown head. 
Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and chocolate with notes of tar.
Flavor is roasted malt, liquorice and tar with notes of coffee and a soft bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2009 aroma is toffee / licorice, a little roasted malts. second try:coffe, roasted malts, hops. second try was much better.
flavor is roasted grains, corffee, faint licorice, fabulously right on the spot with regards to balance of flavors, great stout/porter brew.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 280309.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, liqourice and coffee. Flavor is chocolate, malt, alcohol and oat.

50cl bottle @ VinensVerden, Odense. Pours a thick black colour with a creamy brown head and lacings. Nose is roasted malts and hops. Coffee, chocolate, oat and liquorice. Taste is very bitter from both hops and malts. Quite ashy and syrupy. Smooth, full, oily and sticky palate. Good stuff!

Pretty much black colour with deep beige creamy/foamy head. Aroma is roasted malts, some licorice, mild coffee and chocolate. Also some slight nuttyness. Flavour is roasted malts, some coffee, licorice and mild honeyish and cocoa notes. Another wellbalanced brew from Amager.

Bottle. High lasting creamy brown head. Held towards my lamp I could see a rim light at the bottom revealing this beer as very dark red brown. Without the lamp I would have judged it as black. Creamy and pleasant roasted malt coffee choccolate hops aroma. Surprisingly heavily carbonated and a bit metallic roasted malt coffee choccolate flavor with a fair and long lasting bitter finish.

What a looker! Black coloured, brown head, great lace. On the sweet side, very malty, great balance, so flavourful. Soft and full. Maybe a bit too sweet but has all I like in a Stout.

Bottled. Almost pitch black. Cream, cappucino and licorice in the aroma. Creamy mouthfeel, yet a firm roasty flavor with cappucino, licorice and laurel. A well integrated roastbitterness. Well balanced, elegant stout.

Bottle. Raisins, roasted malt, dark chocolate in aroma. Very dark brown colour with brown head. Ripe fruits in flavour elegantly mixed with hops bitterness and discrete chocolate. Hence, more elegang than Hr. Frederiksen. soft mouthfeel with moderate carbonation.

Very dark brown with a medium brown head. Aroma holds notes of roasted malts, vanilla and lots of sweet chocolate. Sticky palate, sweet and smooth flavor, very very delicate with a decent hop bitterness and some roasted bitterness in the finish aswell.

Black colored with medium sized beige head. Rich creamy aroma with roasted coffee, vanilla and oak, well, for stout, what can I say, excellent one. Medium to full bodied. Flavor is even richer: roastiness and vanilla dominates, licorice and mild vanilla also here. Aftertaste dries with fine hops. Well, I could go with IS here, excellent as stout.
Bottle thanks to hopscotch. Black body with tan head. Big roastiness. Slight effervescence, creamy mouthfeel. Slightly burnt aftertaste.
Black.  Minimal head.  Big chocolate and big coffee aroma and nutty too. Really nice.  Big and thick but balanced.  Dry, nutty finish.  Quality stout.
Bottle. Pours black with a light brown head. Mellow smell of toasted matls. Sweet with aromas of toasted malts. Dark chocolate and and some coffee. Nice hopsprofile. Medium body. Medium carboantion.
Pitch black with medium beige head.Aroma is rosted malt and licorice.Full body and notes of dark chocolate and oile,nice hevey but well balanced beer with smooth finish.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2009 Bottle This beer rocks! Pitch black ale with a small, creamy, light brown head. Good retention. The nose imparts rich, dark, earthy notes of cocoa nibs, ground espresso and pine. Full-bodied and creamy with tickling carbonation. Sweet, chocolaty flavor. A touch vinous and nutty. Chocolaty finish. Many thanks to Grovlam for providing this world class stout!

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2011 Bottle, thx to the brewer, Storm. Pours a beautiful black body under a finger-thick tan head. Chocolate and coffee in the aroma, as well as dusty, piney hops. Chocolate, coffee, molasses notes and a fine hop profile with piney hops giving a fine bitterness. Full-bodied. The lasting finish has both hoppy and coffee-like bitterness. As usual, Amager has made a beauty. Rating: 7-5-8-4-15-3.9. 081031Bottle, shared by Meilby. A dark brown to black body is topped by a finger-thick, tan head. Theres lots of hops in the aroma, citrus and pine cones, but even more roasted malts giving chocolate and coffee. A good dash of chocolate in the flavor, coffee, licorice and a nice hoppy bitterness too. Full-bodied and smooth. Lasting finish with alcohol, coffee and hoppy bitterness. Definitely a lady I could dance with all night. 110114

Hopscotch you are the fucking man.  Black pour.  Aroma is full of roasted malt, chocolate and some hops.  Flavor is rich and full with a great balance between the chocolate malts and some great hops.  This is an amazing beer and I am honored to be entering the first rating in the USA.  Cheers and thanks again Eric.  You really shared a gem this time!
Bottle. Black colour with a light brown head. Aroma is dry, balanced, coffee, roasted, coffee. Flavour is dry, balanced, roasted, coffe, cacao, hop. World class beer.
Draught at EBF 2008, Copenhagen. Black in colour with a great roast malt aroma and flavour. Uber-smooth and flavoursome. A great stout.

Draught at EBF 2008, Copenhagen, Denmark. Clear dark black color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, light to moderate hoppy, resin, grapefruit, alcohol notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium to full, texture is oily - syrupy, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [140908]
Black color, brown head. Tar aroma, licorice and some smoky notes. Tar flavor, some licorice, chocolate, cocoa and rather bitter hop notes. Nice body. Dry bitter tar finish.
Black with a lasting light brown head. Licorice aroma with some burned wood, and some citrus hops. Rich roasted flavour, sweet but quite hoppy. Smooth and fullbodied.

Bottle. Huge dense work creamy brown head that really lasted. Excellent display of lacework. Pitch black bubbly color. Lovely and strong notes of roasted malt, coffee, liquorish. Also sweet chocolate and a hint of berries. Over the palate came a solid base of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Also some underlying floral  hoppy notes. Medium to full bodied with an average carbonation and somewhat dry and at the same time thick texture. Moderated sweet and bitter flavor in balance. Tasty liquorish and roasted malty finish with a touch of sweet chocolate.

[on tap at EBF 2008]
Vanilla aroma with some pleasant sweet, roastiness and definite hops (British?). Reddish-opaque black with nice light brown ring and dots. Very good, dry roasty flavour with a nice bitter bite and some hops bitterness. Mostly roast but still a little sweet malt. Perceptible hops flavour. Dry finish, clean, moderate carbonation, does not seem like 7%.

EBF2008. Fru Frederiksen is a pitch black lady with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of coffee, roasted malt and a little chocolate. The flavour has a light, smooth and mellow malty sweetness and a light roasted bitterness and notes of coffee, light caramel, licorice and a little chocolate. The balance is very nice indeed, and it’s a beer you feel at home in, so to speak, and I would love to have boxes and boxes of this in my cellar.

Sampled at EBF08.
Black with a small, beige/orange head.
Sourish and dark aroma.
A lot of coffee, chocolate, cocoa.
High bitterness.

100ml, draught. My last one (of about 70 tasters) at the splendid European Beer Festival in Copenhagen 08. Thanks to David for the last token! Dark as the devil with a fawn coloured head. The smell consists basically of black coffee with moderate roastiness. Coffee grounds up front leading to a more cappuccino-like flavour, complemented by bitter liquorice. Warming alcohol. A satisfying roundup after three drinking days at the festival (14.09.2008).

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2009 Draught at EBF. Black - brown head. Sweetness, honey, burned, light hoppy, roasted, burned notes, chocolate, nice bitterness, cocoa. Nice smooth stout !!! - Re-Rate: Ja vi fik for mange gode øl på den festival.... Smooth, coffee, chocolate, roasted, light vegetables, nice hoppy.... Nice sharpness.

Pitch black, small tan head. Aroma of licorice, salted licorice. Lots of roasted malts, color malt, ash and tobacco. Toasted aftertaste. It’s more simple than Mister Frederiksen and has a bit too much tobacco in it for being as good as Hr..
Draught at EBF08. Roasted and creamy aroma. Black colour, seems hazy. Good roasted flavour, some cream, hint of cardboard and yeast. Sweet, but well-balanced.

Medium dark brown head. Opaque black body. Sooty burnt coffee aroma, harmonic and balanced, with bready pumpernickel notes. Sweetish burnt mealy coffee taste with grainy rye notes. Rounded and mild. Dry burnt grain aftertaste. Some alcohol heat. Very, very nice. (0.1l taster draft at EBF ’08.)
Draught at EBF 2008. Black colour with a creamy light brown head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and sweet licorice. Nice semi hoppy finish.

Tap @ EBF, 2008, Carlsberg.
Pours completely black with a nice, staying, creamy, brown, film head. Aroma is very soft, chocolate and coffee, cocoa and liquorice. Super soft mouthfeel, great for the ABV. Flavour has smoke, dark chocolate, softly roasted and some coffee. Pleasantly dry, bitter, long aftertaste with light liquorice. Super.

Draught at EBF. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty roasted aroma, and powerfull hoppy. Heavy bitter flavor. Strong hoppy notes. Average finish. Creamy palate. Excellent stout.

Draught at EBF 2008.
Black coloured with a medium sized fast disappearing beige head.
Roasted aroma of coffee, liquorice and hops.
Roasted flavour of liquorice, hops and coffee with notes of pine needles.
Dry roasted and hoppy finish.
Black with large brown head. Sweet aroma with loads of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate notes. Sweet flavour with roasted malt, dark bitter chocolate, coffee and hops. End bitter. Excellent!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2010 First ratingDraught at EBF 2008, Sunday September 14Black color, small beige head. Acidic, malty, licorice scent. Salty, bitter, grainy taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.6/4/7/4/14=3.5RerateDraught at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg, on October 17, 2010. During Porterveckan 2010
Black color, fluffy light brown head. Roasted, green pepper, coffee scent. 
Smooth, sweet, bitter, grainy taste. Bitter and roasted aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel. Medium high bitterness.7/4/7/4/15=3.7

(Draught) Very dark brown with a tiny, tanned head. Sweetish aroma of roasted malt, lots of coffee and some licorice. Roasted, quite burned flavor with roasty black coffee and some ashes. Medium to full body, slightly thin with low carbonation. Too much color malt to be enjoyable, so at least it needs some time to mature.

From tap. Pours dark brown to black with a lacing chocolate brown head. Aroma is mild hoppy and mild roasted malty. Chocolate and roasted malty base flavour swept with a smooth citrusy hops. Nice and smooth finish. But come one - all of these imperial stouts are almost the same - why continue with so many different kinds.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pours opaque pitch black with a creamy, light brown head. Aroma of hard roasted malts and vanilla. Quite a solid body with sweetish, hard roasted malts, burned wood and again some vanilla. Dry, burned malty finish. Very solid and pleasant. 120808
